com.compendium.core.db.management
Class DBConnection

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.db.management.DBConnection

public class DBConnection
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a wrapper class for a Connection object, and stores additional information about its state.

Field Summary
private  java.util.Calendar beginTime
          Used to monitor how long a connection has been busy for
private  boolean bIsBusy
          Indicates if the connection is busy or not
private static int BUSY_TIMEOUT
          A predefined integer to indicate a maximum likely active period for a connection statement run
private static int MYSQL_SESSION_TIMEOUT
          The default timeut used by MySQL.
private  int nDatabaseType
          The type of database this is a connection for.
private  java.sql.Connection oConnection
          A reference to the actual Connection object which this class wraps
private  java.util.Calendar sessionStartTime
          Used to monitor how long a connection has been open for
 
Constructor Summary
DBConnection(java.sql.Connection con, boolean isBusy, int nDatabaseType)
          Constructor

Field Detail

MYSQL_SESSION_TIMEOUT

private static final int MYSQL_SESSION_TIMEOUT
The default timeut used by MySQL. It won't hurt using this on Derby as well.

Constructor Detail

DBConnection

public DBConnection(java.sql.Connection con,
                    boolean isBusy,
                    int nDatabaseType)
Constructor

Parameters:
Connection - con, the connection to use to connect to the database.
boolean - isBusy, indicates if the connection is currently busy.
Method Detail

getConnection

public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
Returns the database connection object.

Returns:
Connection, the curernt database connection object.

setIsBusy

public void setIsBusy(boolean bIsBusy)
Sets if the connection is busy and if it is, records the current time. This will be used by the timedOut method to calculate if the connection is now inactive.

Parameters:
boolean - bIsBusy, sets if this connection is busy.
See Also:
#timedOut

busyTimedOut

public boolean busyTimedOut()
Check to see if this Connection has been apparently active for a long time. but may infact now be inactive.

Returns:
boolean indicating if this connection has probably timed out (is inactive)

sessionTimedOut

public boolean sessionTimedOut()
Check to see if this Connection has timeded out. For MySQL only - (has it been active for more than 8 hours?)

Returns:
boolean indicating if this connection has timed out.

getIsBusy

public boolean getIsBusy()
Returns if the connection is thought to be busy.
